section.title: Setting up the Starter Application
section.para: For creation of a new NEF based application, you will need to download the Starter Application. The starter application is just an empty application that contains the minimal set of files required for NEF web applications. It doesn't do anything particularly useful but you can use this sample as your template for the new project.

section.title: Downloading the Starter Application
section.para: You can download the NEF Starter Application file from http://www.netspective.com/corp/downloads/frameworks/samples

section.title: Setting up the Starter Application (Using Application Server)
Auto Deploying the Starter Application (Using Application Server)
section.para: Copy the downloaded nefs-starter-empty.war file to the webapps folder of your servlet container (application server) and run (or restart) the application server. This creates an Application Directory Structure (see ), containing the necessary NEF files and sub-folders, under the webapps folder of the application server.

section.title: Setting up the Starter Application Manually
section.para: Some servlet containers (application servers) may not auto deploy the war files. In such cases you need to manually set up your starter application using the following steps:

listitem.para: Create a new folder in the webapps folder of your application server. Change this folder's name to nefs-starter-empty

figure.title: Creating a New Folder for NEFS Starter Application

listitem.para: Extract the contents of nefs-starter-empty.war file into this newly created folder. You may use any ZIP file extraction utility, such as WinZip or WinRAR, for this purpose.
This creates an Application Directory Structure (see ), containing the necessary NEF files and sub-folders, within the nefs-starter-empty folder.

section.title: Testing the Starter Application in a Browser
section.para: Use a web browser to access the root of the starter application using the URL of the form http://host:port/nefs-starter-empty. If everything worked as it should, you will see the Starter Application Welcome Page.

section.title: Verifying the Console
section.para: Use a browser to access the Console of the Starter Application. This will ensure not just the proper configuration of the application but also its proper configuration in relax to Sparx. In a web browser, we can go to the following URL: http://host:port/nefs-starter-empty/console. If everything is working, you will see the application Console login screen.

Congratulations! You now have an empty application upon which you can build. You can log in to your application's Console. The Console's default User Id is 'console' and the default Password is 'console'(each without quotes). Unless otherwise specified, that is the User Id and Password combination you should use if the Console prompts you to login.
